title: global Overwrites
content:
The ``global`` keyword is actually enough to overwrite a local variable.
In this illustration, the default value is used to trigger fetching the global variable ``$argv``. The instruction is alone in the block, but it actually replaces the current variable, aka the parameter, by the global one. No assignation in sight, mererly a surprise.
This won't work with superglobal, such as ``$_POST``, which can't be overwritten by a parameter.
